body_html:
I've thought about this some more and realized that tensorflow expression aren't necessarily holomorphic, which means returning a complex number doesn't always make sense.
Maybe it would be better to throw an error if the user tries to differentiate a complex expression?
The user can always insert a tf.real to make it work the way it currently does, and this would prevent accidental mistakes.

body:
I've thought about this some more and realized that tensorflow expression aren't necessarily holomorphic, which means returning a complex number doesn't always make sense.
Maybe it would be better to throw an error if the user tries to differentiate a complex expression?
The user can always insert a `tf.real` to make it work the way it currently does, and this would prevent accidental mistakes.
